function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Limited control of tenants over indoor environmental quality may lead to suboptimal conditions for mitigating contagious diseases propagation.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Subjective evaluations of indoor environments by occupants may not align with objective measures, leading to discrepancies in assessing indoor environmental quality.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Narrow control clauses in commercial office tenancy agreements may lead to suboptimal indoor temperature management, potentially impacting occupant comfort and energy efficiency.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High energy expenditure during the operational phase of buildings and non-compliance with energy efficiency standards can lead to significant environmental and climate impacts.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid growth of technology industry leading to increased data mining and analytics","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Democratization of analytics for non-experts through easy-to-use web tools and dashboards","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Emphasis on big data leading to prioritization of data-driven research over traditional scientific method","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Growth of IoT and WSN implementation without harmonization of noninteroperable technologies and protocols.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Challenges in managing big data from wireless sensor networks, characterized by volume, velocity, and variety.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Industry-driven development of business intelligence and analytics BIA tools without significant academic input.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dense distribution of sensing devices increases the risk of pathogen spread in case of contamination.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Wireless transmission of data between nodes may facilitate the spread of contagious diseases if nodes are contaminated.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Large-scale deployment of WSN without proper security measures may lead to unauthorized access and potential malicious interference, including spreading malware or viruses.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Proliferation of network-addressable devices embedded in everyday objects","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Number of connected devices to reach over 20 billion 'things' by 2020","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Placement of wireless sensing devices nodes in and around the phenomena of interest","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of off-the-shelf transducers may lead to inaccuracies in data collection for thermal comfort field studies.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited scale and scope of proof-of-concept or project-specific IEQ monitoring systems may hinder their widespread implementation in built environments.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Shift in technological context to low-cost hardware and open-source software may introduce cybersecurity vulnerabilities in IEQ monitoring systems.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of efficient IEQ monitoring","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate measurement of indoor environmental quality IEQ","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of outdated comfort assessment systems","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate health policymaking in China and elsewhere","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of emphasis on curbing climate change","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of concern for the health of the environment","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Correlation between air pollution and human illness","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Extended survival of bioaerosols due to PM5 and No2","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Higher mortality rates in provinces with worst air pollution","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Technical and methodological differences between ground-stations and satellite observations could lead to discordance in correlation analyses, impacting the interpretation of air pollution levels.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uneven spatial coverage and limited spatial coverage of traditional ground stations may lead to incomplete representation of pollution levels experienced by populations in their proximity.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited information about covariables such as health services, epidemiological traits, and population movement hinders the assessment of the relative importance of air pollution among socio-environmental driving factors of COVID-19 infections.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Air pollutants serving as airborne vectors for virus transmission","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Positive correlation between respiratory illness and chronic exposure to air pollutants","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Presence of virus fragments in particulate matter","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Association between COVID-19 and chronic exposure to air pollution","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High levels of air pollutants such as formaldehyde, carbon monoxide, and particulate matter PM 2.5 are associated with increased COVID-19 infections and fatalities.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Negative correlation between aerosol data from satellites and COVID-19 fatalities, but positive correlation with infections.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contrary to other pollutants, higher levels of O3 and SO2 from satellite and ground data were not associated with more COVID-19 deaths and mortality rates.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Correlation analysis between air pollution and COVID-19 variables","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Geospatial mapping and visualization of COVID-19 and air pollution","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High viral infections in areas with air pollutants","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited systematic COVID-19 testing at a national scale in China, leading to exclusion of asymptomatic cases and potentially inflated mortality rates.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of satellite and ground station data to compute average air pollution measurements at the prefecture level in China.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Chronic exposure to air pollution linked to spread of SARS-CoV-2 in Chinese cities.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of COVID-19 as a highly contagious respiratory illness caused by a novel coronavirus","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk factors for fast spread of the virus, including age, gender, and smoking status","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Environmental factors contributing to the emergence and spread of epidemics, including overpopulation, biodiversity loss, and climate change","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Weak public health surveillance","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of inter-institutional collaboration","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate economic and social impact management","category":"Society","confidence":"High"}]}
